name: Opus audio format
description: Royalty-free open audio codec by IETF, which incorporated SILK from Skype and CELT from Xiph.org, to serve higher sound quality and lower latency at the same bitrate.

links.title: Google's statement about the use of VP8 and Opus codec for WebRTC standard

notes.general:
Support refers to this format's use in the `audio` element, not other conditions.

For Opera the Linux version may be able to play it when the GStreamer module is up to date and the served mime-type is 'audio/ogg'.

byNum.1: Supported only when packaged in a CAF file and on macOS High Sierra/iOS 11 or later (constant bit-rate only).
byNum.2: Supported in a WebM container (all bitrates). Has a [known regression](https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=245428).
byNum.3: Supported in a WebM container (all bitrates).
byNum.4: Partial support refers to requiring macOS 15.4 Sequoia or later.
